result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew C Juozapaitis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - County Ordinance. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid in 60 days or penalty of 9 days jail, consecutive, for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.
Jury status hearing on September 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Andrew C Juozapaitis did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Attorney appears by authorization.    Attorney Huppertz requests the Court set the matter for trial.  The Court schedules accordingly.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 13, 2016 at 08:15 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on June 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Andrew C Juozapaitis did not appear.   Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is currently in treatment and requests a plea date.   Plea hearing scheduled for June 22, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Authorization to appear received and filed.

Attorney Matthew Huppertz in court.   Defendant Andrew C Juozapaitis did not appear.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Huppertz advises the Court he has received discovery and an offer.  The Attorney to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Andrew C Juozapaitis in court.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant advises the Court he has not retained counsel.  The Defendant is to apply at the public defender's office and return back to Court.   The Court recalls the case with the same appearances.  The Defendant does not qualify for representation by the public defender's office.  The Defendant is sworn in.  The Court takes the petition under advisement for 30 days.  The Defendant should obtain counsel privately.  The Defendant receives a copy of the pretrial offer and criminal complaint in Court.  Hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster. Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Amy or AJ. listed in the criminal complaint

Defendant Andrew C Juozapaitis in court.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
